title: Motion the court to dismiss driving on suspended license cit. that were result from unlawful judgement.
question: Can I motion the court to dismiss driving on suspended license and driving without valid license infraction citations that were result from unlawful judgement. I want to get damages of $1700 back for impoundment fees because the insurance claim was fraudulent. Should I sue with seperate order for citations or motion to vacate judgement and citations and i was thinking summary judgment then sue for damages.

Your question is missing many details, so you will ultimately need to see an attorney to get his sorted out. My answer will need to make some assumptions that might be wrong, but I will do my best.

It sounds like you might have a unpaid judgment related to an auto accident. If true, the judgment creditor can report the judgment to the Department of Motor Vehicles and your license can be suspended. Whether or not you believe the judgment is "unlawful" is irrelevant. It is considered lawful until a higher court rules differently. If you appeal the "unlawful" judgment in timely manner, it will remain a lawful judgment. So the most common way to deal with the suspension is to pay the judgment in full, make a satisfactory payment arrangement or file for bankruptcy to wipe out the judgment.

So until you take steps to eliminate the judgment that you claim is unlawful, none of the strategies you propose will have any legal effect. You need to see an attorney about this.
